item.title: Fixed - please removed
item.dc:creator: @south-park south-park
item.description:
@south-park wrote:

Found it. But how would I get it to update something server sided?

public void processTabClick() { if (super.clickMode3 == 1) { if (super.saveClickX >= 539 && super.saveClickX <= 573 && super.saveClickY >= 169 && super.saveClickY < 205 && tabInterfaceIDs[0] != -1) { needDrawTabArea = true; tabID = 0; tabAreaAltered = true; } if (super.saveClickX >= 569 && super.saveClickX <= 599 && super.saveClickY >= 168 && super.saveClickY < 205 && tabInterfaceIDs[1] != -1) { needDrawTabArea = true; tabID = 1; tabAreaAltered = true; } if (super.saveClickX >= 597 && super.saveClickX <= 627 && super.saveClickY >= 168 && super.saveClickY < 205 && tabInterfaceIDs[2] != -1) { needDrawTabArea = true; tabID = 2; tabAreaAltered = true; } if (super.saveClickX >= 625 && super.saveClickX <= 669 && super.saveClickY >= 168 && super.saveClickY < 203 && tabInterfaceIDs[3] != -1) { needDrawTabArea = true; tabID = 3; tabAreaAltered = true; } if (super.saveClickX >= 666 && super.saveClickX <= 696 && super.saveClickY >= 168 && super.saveClickY < 205 && tabInterfaceIDs[4] != -1) { needDrawTabArea = true; tabID = 4; tabAreaAltered = true; } if (super.saveClickX >= 694 && super.saveClickX <= 724 && super.saveClickY >= 168 && super.saveClickY < 205 && tabInterfaceIDs[5] != -1) { needDrawTabArea = true; tabID = 5; tabAreaAltered = true; } if (super.saveClickX >= 722 && super.saveClickX <= 756 && super.saveClickY >= 169 && super.saveClickY < 205 && tabInterfaceIDs[6] != -1) { needDrawTabArea = true; tabID = 6; tabAreaAltered = true; } if (super.saveClickX >= 540 && super.saveClickX <= 574 && super.saveClickY >= 466 && super.saveClickY < 502 && tabInterfaceIDs[7] != -1) { needDrawTabArea = true; tabID = 7; tabAreaAltered = true; } if (super.saveClickX >= 572 && super.saveClickX <= 602 && super.saveClickY >= 466 && super.saveClickY < 503 && tabInterfaceIDs[8] != -1) { needDrawTabArea = true; tabID = 8; tabAreaAltered = true; } if (super.saveClickX >= 599 && super.saveClickX <= 629 && super.saveClickY >= 466 && super.saveClickY < 503 && tabInterfaceIDs[9] != -1) { needDrawTabArea = true; tabID = 9; tabAreaAltered = true; } if (super.saveClickX >= 627 && super.saveClickX <= 671 && super.saveClickY >= 467 && super.saveClickY < 502 && tabInterfaceIDs[10] != -1) { needDrawTabArea = true; tabID = 10; tabAreaAltered = true; } if (super.saveClickX >= 669 && super.saveClickX <= 699 && super.saveClickY >= 466 && super.saveClickY < 503 && tabInterfaceIDs[11] != -1) { needDrawTabArea = true; tabID = 11; tabAreaAltered = true; } if (super.saveClickX >= 696 && super.saveClickX <= 726 && super.saveClickY >= 466 && super.saveClickY < 503 && tabInterfaceIDs[12] != -1) { needDrawTabArea = true; tabID = 12; tabAreaAltered = true; } if (super.saveClickX >= 724 && super.saveClickX <= 758 && super.saveClickY >= 466 && super.saveClickY < 502 && tabInterfaceIDs[13] != -1) { needDrawTabArea = true; tabID = 13; tabAreaAltered = true; } if (anInt1054 == tabID) { stream.createFrame(152); stream.writeWordBigEndian(tabID); } } }

Read full topic

item.title: Fixed - please removed
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:17, topic:519547”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=638012.msg4300482#msg4300482 date=1368910029]

Does it not print server sided? In ClickingButtons or ButtonHandler (w.e its called in PI) there should be a switch statement with all your button clicks & actions? Just add a default case doing System.out.println("buttonID: " + buttonId); or something like that.

Sidebar buttons don’t have server sided ID’s, that I know of.
I never have seen them print. Regardless of where I put debug code.
[/quote]

What do you mean server sided ID’s? The client sends the ID to server that’s what the packet handling is there for.[/quote]
What I mean is, that the ID just isn’t shown ever. I had a similar problem with tabs… I searched for a way to trace it in my server and found nothing. Then I found it in the client, but didn’t see a way to have it show on the server.
The client sends the ID to the server to get a yes/or no. If it gets a yes, the tab would show, and the server would again, tell the client what to show. I don’t really know how to explain this. It sounds great in my mind, and then I put words to it and it’s like blurgdefurhur.
The tabs are set in the client and have super.x / super.y positioning and are handled by clicking there as well, from what I’ve seen.

Edit:
But the server tells the client what interface is to be in that tab, if any.

Read full topic

item.title: Fixed - please removed
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Vain_:

setting the sidebar interface to a negative number results in the drawing of a blank interface, not a blank icon.

I know that’s what I said. Not the exact words. I said I forget how to hide the actual button. It was in one of my old servers, I’ll go see if I still have it.

Edit:
Upon looking, I was using this:
c.getPacketSender().sendSidebar(0, -1);
It would actually blank the icon.

I believe you need to create a packet for sendSidebar that would tell the client to hide the icon.

Read full topic

item.title: Fixed - please removed
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Vain_:

are you trying to disable the tabs until the tutorial is progressed?

That’s what I’m thinking now.
You need to set the sidebar interface to -1.
And there’s a way to actually hide the button but I forget…
so here’s an example:
setSidebar(6, -1);
That would set sidebar number 6 to -1, or not there.
Some server’s use setSidebarInterface.
